job_description:
• BS or MS in Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field6+ years of Engineering experienceExperience in AWS and GCPExcellent programming skills in Python / Java / Terraform / GoMust be a self-starter, highly motivated, able to shift directions quickly when priorities change, think through problems to come up with innovative solutions and deliver against very tight deadlinesWillingness to learn and master unfamiliar technologies and/or conceptsStrong analytical & problem solving skillsExcellent spoken and written communication as well as receptive listening skills, with ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiencesProactive and forward thinking attitude and creative problem solving abilityExcellent team player able to work with virtual and global cross functional teamsSystems: Experience in Cloud Technologies like AWS and GCP Life at Salesforce Our Locations Our Locations North America Europe, Middle East, and Africa Asia Pacific Latin America Our Teams Our Teams Sales Technology & Product Customer Success Corporate Roles AI Research University University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Talent Programs Talent Programs Overview Future Pathways India Return to Work Military Fellows Our Story Newsroom Blog Careers Trust Salesforce.
• Sitemap Legal Terms of Service Privacy Information Responsible Disclosure Trust Contact Manage Preferences Excellent analytical and coding skills.
• Must have expertise in Python, Javascript, GoExperience in Postgress, Terraform, Kubernetes, Karpenter is preferred.
• Experience in public cloud skills AWS/GCPExperience with Puppet University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Knowledge in Elastic Search/Kibana stack.
• You are intrinsically motivated and a lifetime learner.
• You are unintimidated by ambiguity or a hard problem and are always looking for ways to innovate, improve, and raise the bar.
• Demonstrate high proficiency in engineering best practices, such as accessibility, fault tolerance, concurrency, reusability, extensibility, API design, maintainability, security, scalability, testability, and overall quality.
• You can lead engineers by example in continuously improving both the quality and productivity of your deliverables.

job_title: EUV Lithography Process Development Engineer- TPG
job_description:
• Required Education: Degree/Major: M.
• In Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, or study relevant to Photolithography plus at least 3 years of semiconductor industry experience.
• In Engineering, Chemistry, or Physics with 10+ years of semiconductor industry process related experience with emphasis on Photolithography Coursework or proven experience showing strong statistical analysis skills, including design of experiments and data analysis.
• Experience with JMP, Python, or other statistical analysis software is helpful Develop EUV modules in our technology development (TD) site.
• This includes setting up lithography processes and working with other process areas and process integration to meet manufacturing requirements.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.
• Collaborate with manufacturing sites to align on equipment and materials requirements, and to make sure EUV processes are aligned for transfer.
• Knowledge of optics for photolithography or experience with photolithography simulation software such as Prolith or S-Litho is helpful.
